chapter.title: Setting up on &debian;/&redhat; &kvm;
chapter.para: First time users are recommend getting virt-manager to work before I trying vmimagemanager. virt-manager has a simple GUI for creating virtual maschines which has a dependacy upon libvirt, further it is available in fedora, and debian flavours of line so only a command line away.

section.title: LVM Setup
section.para: KVM and vmimagmanager work with partitionions exported to the virtual maschine as disks. LVM should thierfore be set with a partition per VIrtual Slot. These partitions will be configured for the virtual maschine as disks vmimagemanger can help with that.
